channel.title: XI-IATI Org ID Structure Discussion
channel.description:
To be clear about the current process for creating Org IDs: the Tech Team requests an 'XI-IATI' Org ID when there is no existing [org-id.guide](http://org-id.guide/) identifier that is suitable for their organisation; and the Org ID team cannot identify a new identifier that may be available to create for that organisation.
Currently, we simply request for `XI-IATI` + `a short acronym or abbreviation for the organisation` (i.e. [XI-IATI-ATTIC](https://discuss.iatistandard.org/t/added-new-organisation-identifier-xi-iati-attic/1655)) is used and added to the list of [IATI-maintained Org IDs](http://reference.iatistandard.org/203/codelists/IATIOrganisationIdentifier/).
In a recent XI-IATI Org ID request [post](https://discuss.iatistandard.org/t/new-organisation-identifier-xi-iati-esfd/1898), it has been suggested that a country code (and perhaps an org-type code as well) could be added to XI-IATI Org IDs, to more easily identify the identity of the organisation. e.g. XI-IATI-ATTIC-TD (as Attic is based in Chad).
Further conversations have also been had in this regard previously: - https://discuss.iatistandard.org/t/added-change-the-guidance-on-xi-iati-organisation-identifiers/604 - https://discuss.iatistandard.org/t/use-of-xi-identifiers-for-national-or-sub-national-ngos-and-csos/1658/14
We have created this post so that this can be discussed further while not inhibiting the publishing process for a particular organisation.

item.title: XI-IATI Org ID Structure Discussion
item.dc:creator: IATI-techteam
item.description:
To be clear about the current process for creating Org IDs: the Tech Team requests an ‘XI-IATI’ Org ID when there is no existing org-id.guide identifier that is suitable for their organisation; and the Org ID team cannot identify a new identifier that may be available to create for that organisation.

Currently, we simply request for XI-IATI + a short acronym or abbreviation for the organisation (i.e. XI-IATI-ATTIC) is used and added to the list of IATI-maintained Org IDs.

In a recent XI-IATI Org ID request post, it has been suggested that a country code (and perhaps an org-type code as well) could be added to XI-IATI Org IDs, to more easily identify the identity of the organisation. e.g. XI-IATI-ATTIC-TD (as Attic is based in Chad).

Further conversations have also been had in this regard previously:

  • [Added] Change the guidance on XI-IATI- organisation identifiers
  • Use of XI identifiers for national or sub-national NGOs and CSOs

We have created this post so that this can be discussed further while not inhibiting the publishing process for a particular organisation.
